title: Juvenile seriously injured in Todds Lane shooting in Hampton
content:
Please install the latest Adobe Flash Player Plugin to watch this content.
HAMPTON, Va. (WAVY) — A juvenile was seriously injured in a shooting Sunday evening in Hampton.
Officers responded to the scene around Todds Lane and Northampton Drive after dispatchers were alerted at 3:47 p.m.
Police say a male juvenile was shot and went to Sentara CarePlex Hospital. His injuries were considered life-threatening.
Dijuan Holland lives in the area and says the crime scene stretched the entire block.
“It went down the block from the school,” said Holland. “This is a very quiet neighborhood and I’ve been here since I was small and I’ve never seen something like this.”
The shooting happened just across the street from Alfred S. Forrest Elementary School.
“I see little kids come up the street everyday that go to Forrest and back and I see little kids out here play and it’s just too much, too much,” said Holland. “It’s a New Year and we should do something a little better than what we’ve been doing.”
There is no other information at this time.
Stay on WAVY.com for developments in this story.
